titlestmt.titleproper: Unidentified Family Vacation Photograph Album circa 1920-1929.
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by MarcEdit

publicationstmt.publisher: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard)

address.addressline: Oregon Historical Society Davies Family Research Library

did.abstract: 171 black and white photographs in 1 album, ca. 1920-1929, of an unidentified family vacationing in mostly unidentified places around the United States.

scopecontent.p: 171 black and white photographs in 1 album, ca. 1920-1929, of an unidentified family vacationing in mostly unidentified places around the United States. Locations include Multnomah Falls and the Columbia River Gorge in Oregon, New England, Niagara Falls, the Southwest, and Yellowstone Park.

accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to the public.

userestrict.p: The Oregon Historical Society is the owner of the materials in the Research Library and makes available reproductions for research, publication, and other uses. Written permission must be obtained from the Research Library before any reproduction use. The Society does not necessarily hold copyright to all of the materials in the collections. In some cases, permission for use may require seeking additional authorization from the copyright owners.

prefercite.p: Unidentified Family Vacation Photograph Album, Album 703, Oregon Historical Society Research Library.
